moduleMetadataJson.name: Windows Manage PowerShell Download and/or Execute
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This module will download and execute a PowerShell script over a meterpreter session.
        The user may also enter text substitutions to be made in memory before execution.
        Setting VERBOSE to true will output both the script prior to execution and the results.
author: Nicholas Nam (nick <Nicholas Nam (nick@executionflow.org)>
RageLtMan <rageltman@sempervictus>

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: SESSION
options.description: The session to run this module on.

options.name: Powershell::persist
options.description: Run the payload in a loop

options.name: Powershell::wrap_double_quotes
options.description: Wraps the -Command argument in single quotes

options.name: Powershell::method
options.description: Payload delivery method (Accepted: net, reflection, old, msil)

options.name: Powershell::Post::timeout
options.description: Powershell execution timeout, set < 0 to run async without termination

options.name: SCRIPT
options.description: Path to the local PS script

options.name: SUBSTITUTIONS
options.description: Script subs in gsub format - original,sub;original,sub

options.name: DRY_RUN
options.description: Only show what would be done
